result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Watts Jr

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bail.  (Jerome Watts, Jr. - #2022007039, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION. All other conditions remain the same.
Bail motion by Defense argued and partially GRANTED by the Court. Cash Bond lowered to $35,000.00.  All conditions remain the same.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Jerome Watts Jr. Defendant Jerome Watts Jr in court, in custody.   Prosecuting attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Motion Hearing. Defense motion to dismiss count 1 of the complaint moot as state has filed an amended information. As to rescind order, Court will reinstate the defendants phone privileges and advised the defendant not to contact the victims in this case. 

Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within 45 days.  Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:15 am.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered charge amended to REPEATED SEXUAL ASSAULT OF A CHILD, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.02(1) or (2) 948.025(1)(e), 939.50(3)(c), a Class C Felony.
Defendant's Motion for Bond Reduction.  (Jerome Watts, Jr. - #2022007039, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Rescinding Order, signed and filed.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Jerome Watts Jr. Defendant Jerome Watts Jr not in court, in custody.   Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Scheduling Conference. State has filed motion to rescind privileges. Court will GRANT state's motion. Defense filed a bail motion and motion to dismiss. Court will hear defense motion and state's rescind motion at the next hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
MOTION TO RESCIND; filed.
filed.
Motion to Dismiss Count One of the Information; filed.
Regarding Videotaped Statements; filed.
Scheduling conference on September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Case assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28 in error. Case has been reassigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner.

Defendant Jerome Watts in court by video with Attorney Patrick Flanagan who appears in person.  Defendant Jerome Watts in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Holzem. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Motion for Bail Modification.  (Jerome Watts, Jr. - #202200739, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Jerome Watts not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Memorandum from State Public Defender's office as to efforts to appoint counsel - received
Received and Filed: Motion from Defendant

Defendant Jerome Watts not in court, defendant in custody.   Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed a Motion from defendant.  DK
RETURN ADDRESS:  #2022007039  MILWAUKEE CO. JAIL
949 N. 9TH STREET  MILWAUKEE, WI 53233
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AG; J.G.; HER; J.R.; Brandy T; Mary L.W.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; 24/7 curfew with the exception of verified employment, medical and legal appointments..  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $60,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.

Defendant Jerome Watts in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jerome Watts in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerome Watts appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
